summary.span: 表示雙精度浮點數。

span.span: Represents a double-precision floating-point number.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 實值類型代表範圍是從負 1.79769313486232 e 308 到正 1.79769313486232 e 308，因為正或負 0、 值的雙精確度 64 位元數字， ，並不是數字 ().The value type represents a double-precision 64-bit number with values ranging from negative 1.79769313486232e308 to positive 1.79769313486232e308, as well as positive or negative zero, , , and not a number (). 它用來代表值的極大 （例如行星或個之間的距離） 或極小 （公斤中進展屬於分子大量） 以及，通常並不精確 （例如距離地球另一個太陽系），符合 IEC 60559:1989 (IEEE 754) 標準二進位浮點算術類型。It is intended to represent values that are extremely large (such as distances between planets or galaxies) or extremely small (the molecular mass of a substance in kilograms) and that often are imprecise (such as the distance from earth to another solar system), The type complies with the IEC 60559:1989 (IEEE 754) standard for binary floating-point arithmetic. 本主題包含下列章節：This topic consists of the following sections: - [浮點表示和有效位數Floating-point representation and precision](#Precision) - [測試相等Testing for equality](#Equality) - [浮點值和例外狀況Floating-point values and exceptions](#Exceptions) - [類型轉換和雙精確度結構Type conversions and the Double structure](#Conversions) - [浮點數的功能Floating-point functionality](#Functionality) ## 浮點表示和有效位數Floating-Point Representation and Precision 資料型別會儲存雙精確度浮點值的 64 位元的二進位格式下, 表所示：The data type stores double-precision floating-point values in a 64-bit binary format, as shown in the following table: |組件Part|位元Bits| |----------|----------| |有效數字或尾數Significand or mantissa|0-510-51| |指數Exponent|52-6252-62| |符號 (0 = 正數、 1 = 負數)Sign (0 = Positive, 1 = Negative)|6363| 就像小數是無法精確地表示某些小數值 (例如 1/3 或)，二進位分數是無法表示某些小數的值。Just as decimal fractions are unable to precisely represent some fractional values (such as 1/3 or ), binary fractions are unable to represent some fractional values. 例如，1/10，精確地.1 以小數表示，會以.001100110011 為二進位分數，以模式"0011"重複為無限大。For example, 1/10, which is represented precisely by .1 as a decimal fraction, is represented by .001100110011 as a binary fraction, with the pattern "0011" repeating to infinity. 在此情況下，浮點值提供它所代表的數字不精確表示法。In this case, the floating-point value provides an imprecise representation of the number that it represents. 經常執行的原始浮點數的值，其他數學運算，會增加其缺少的有效位數。Performing additional mathematical operations on the original floating-point value often tends to increase its lack of precision. 例如，如果我們比較相乘.1 10 的 9 次新增至.1.1，我們看到該以外的地方，因為它有八個更多的作業，已產生較不精確的結果。For example, if we compare the result of multiplying .1 by 10 and adding .1 to .1 nine times, we see that addition, because it has involved eight more operations, has produced the less precise result. 請注意，此差異是只有當我們會顯示兩個明顯藉由使用"R"[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，如果需要，將會顯示所有 17 位有效位數所支援型別。Note that this disparity is apparent only if we display the two values by using the "R" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), which if necessary displays all 17 digits of precision supported by the type. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/representation1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/representation1.vb#3)] 小數的二進位值無法完全代表一些數字，因為浮點數可以只近似實際數字。Because some numbers cannot be represented exactly as fractional binary values, floating-point numbers can only approximate real numbers. 所有的浮點數也會有有限的數目的有效位數，其中也會決定如何精確的浮點值近似實際數字。All floating-point numbers also have a limited number of significant digits, which also determines how accurately a floating-point value approximates a real number. A值具有最多 15 個有效小數位數，雖然內部維護最多 17 個位數。A value has up to 15 decimal digits of precision, although a maximum of 17 digits is maintained internally. 這表示某些浮點運算可能缺少的有效位數變更為浮點值。This means that some floating-point operations may lack the precision to change a floating point value. 下列範例提供一個實例。The following example provides an illustration. 它會定義非常大的浮點值，並將乘積和它超過了一千兆。It defines a very large floating-point value, and then adds the product of and one quadrillion to it. 不過，產品是太小，無法修改原始的浮點值。The product, however, is too small to modify the original floating-point value. 而在產品中的最大有效位數為 1，其最小顯著性數字是千分之一，-312。Its least significant digit is thousandths, whereas the most significant digit in the product is 1-312. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/representation2.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/representation2.vb#4)] 浮點數限制有效位數有數個結果：The limited precision of a floating-point number has several consequences: - 因為其最小有效位數不同，對特定有效位數的兩個浮點數可能不比較相等。Two floating-point numbers that appear equal for a particular precision might not compare equal because their least significant digits are different. 在下列範例中，一系列的數字加在一起，並與其預期的總計進行比較，其總和。In the following example, a series of numbers are added together, and their total is compared with their expected total. 雖然兩個值會出現相同，呼叫`Equals`方法表示不會。Although the two values appear to be the same, a call to the `Equals` method indicates that they are not. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist3.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist3.vb#6)] 如果您變更中的格式項目陳述式從`{0}`和`{1}`至`{0:R}`和`{1:R}`顯示全部有效位數的兩個很明顯的兩個值相等的值，因為失去了在加法作業期間的有效位數。If you change the format items in the statement from `{0}` and `{1}` to `{0:R}` and `{1:R}` to display all significant digits of the two values, it is clear that the two values are unequal because of a loss of precision during the addition operations. 在此情況下，解決問題，藉由呼叫方法要捨入執行比較之前所需的有效位數的值。In this case, the issue can be resolved by calling the method to round the values to the desired precision before performing the comparison. - 使用浮點數的數學或比較作業可能不會產生相同的結果使用十進位數字時，如果因為二進位的浮點數可能不等於的十進位數字。A mathematical or comparison operation that uses a floating-point number might not yield the same result if a decimal number is used, because the binary floating-point number might not equal the decimal number. 前一個範例會說明這藉由顯示乘以.1 10 和加入.1 時間的結果。A previous example illustrated this by displaying the result of multiplying .1 by 10 and adding .1 times. 精確度小數值與數值作業中的很重要，您可以使用而不是型別。When accuracy in numeric operations with fractional values is important, you can use the rather than the type. 當數字的操作，具有超過範圍的整數值的精確度或類型非常重要，使用型別。When accuracy in numeric operations with integral values beyond the range of the or types is important, use the type. - 值可能不會反覆存取如果牽涉到浮點數。A value might not round-trip if a floating-point number is involved. 如果作業會將原始浮點數轉換成另一種形式，反運算將轉換回浮點數，轉換的形式，而且最終浮點數不等於原始值，即稱為往返浮點數。A value is said to round-trip if an operation converts an original floating-point number to another form, an inverse operation transforms the converted form back to a floating-point number, and the final floating-point number is not equal to the original floating-point number. 來回行程可能會失敗，因為一個或多個最小有效位數遺失或變更在轉換中。The round trip might fail because one or more least significant digits are lost or changed in a conversion. 在下列範例中，三個值會轉換成字串並儲存於檔案中。In the following example, three values are converted to strings and saved in a file. 如輸出所示，不過，即使值看起來相同，則還原的值不等於原始值。As the output shows, however, even though the values appear to be identical, the restored values are not equal to the original values. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist4.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist4.vb#7)] 在此情況下，值可以成功地反覆使用"G17"[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)保留完整的有效位數的值，如下列範例所示。In this case, the values can be successfully round-tripped by using the "G17" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) to preserve the full precision of values, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist5.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist5.vb#8)] > [!IMPORTANT] > 當搭配失敗來成功反覆存取原始值的值，在某些情況下的"R"格式規範。When used with a value, the "R" format specifier in some cases fails to successfully round-trip the original value. 若要確保成功地反覆存取值會使用"G17"格式規範。To ensure that values successfully round-trip, use the "G17" format specifier. - 值有較少精確度卻高於值。 values have less precision than values. A值轉換成看似相等通常不等於稍微有效位數的值。A value that is converted to a seemingly equivalent often does not equal the value because of differences in precision. 在下列範例中，相同的除法運算的結果指派給和值。In the following example, the result of identical division operations is assigned to a and a value. 之後值轉換成，比較兩個值會顯示不相等。After the value is cast to a , a comparison of the two values shows that they are unequal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist1.vb#5)] 若要避免這個問題，請使用取代資料型別或使用方法，讓這兩個值具有相同的有效位數。To avoid this problem, use either the in place of the data type, or use the method so that both values have the same precision. 此外，使用算術和指派作業的結果值可能稍有不同的平台的精確度遺失的因為型別。In addition, the result of arithmetic and assignment operations with values may differ slightly by platform because of the loss of precision of the type. 例如，指派常值的結果值可能不同的 32 位元和 64 位元版本的.NET framework。For example, the result of assigning a literal value may differ in the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the .NET Framework. 下列範例將說明這點時的差異是常值值-4.42330604244772E-305 和變數，其值為-4.42330604244772E-305 指派給變數。The following example illustrates this difference when the literal value -4.42330604244772E-305 and a variable whose value is -4.42330604244772E-305 are assigned to a variable. 請注意，結果方法在此情況下並不會發生遺失有效位數。Note that the result of the method in this case does not suffer from a loss of precision. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Class.Precision#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.class.precision/cs/precision1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Class.Precision#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.class.precision/vb/precision1.vb#1)] ## 測試相等Testing for Equality 被視為相等，兩個值必須代表相同的值。To be considered equal, two values must represent identical values. 不過，因為精確度值之間的差異，或因為遺失有效位數，由一或兩個值，都必須通常是相同的浮點值變得不相等因為在其最小有效位數的差異。However, because of differences in precision between values, or because of a loss of precision by one or both values, floating-point values that are expected to be identical often turn out to be unequal because of differences in their least significant digits. 如此一來，呼叫方法，以判斷兩個值是否相等或呼叫方法，以判斷兩個之間的關聯性值，通常會產生非預期的結果。As a result, calls to the method to determine whether two values are equal, or calls to the method to determine the relationship between two values, often yield unexpected results. 這明顯是在下列範例中，其中兩個明顯等於值而是不相等，因為第一個有 15 位數的精確度，第二個有 17。This is evident in the following example, where two apparently equal values turn out to be unequal because the first has 15 digits of precision, while the second has 17. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison1.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison1.vb#9)] 導出的值，遵循不同的程式碼路徑，和，通常操作不同的方式證明不相等。Calculated values that follow different code paths and that are manipulated in different ways often prove to be unequal. 在下列範例中，一個平方值，並計算然後還原為原始值的平方根。In the following example, one value is squared, and then the square root is calculated to restore the original value. 第二個乘以 3.51 且平方之前 3.51 還原原始值除以結果的平方根。A second is multiplied by 3.51 and squared before the square root of the result is divided by 3.51 to restore the original value. 雖然兩個值變成完全相同，呼叫方法指出它們是否不相等。Although the two values appear to be identical, a call to the method indicates that they are not equal. 使用"R"標準格式字串傳回結果字串，其中顯示每個雙精度浮點數值的所有有效位數顯示第二個值是.0000000000001 小於第一個。Using the "R" standard format string to return a result string that displays all the significant digits of each Double value shows that the second value is .0000000000001 less than the first. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison2.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison2.vb#10)] 在失去有效位數很可能會影響比較的結果的情況下，您可以採用以下的替代方案，於呼叫的任何或方法：In cases where a loss of precision is likely to affect the result of a comparison, you can adopt any of the following alternatives to calling the or method: - 呼叫方法，以確保這兩個值都有相同的精確度。Call the method to ensure that both values have the same precision. 下列範例會修改上一個範例為使用這種方法，使兩個小數值相等。The following example modifies a previous example to use this approach so that two fractional values are equivalent. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison3.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison3.vb#11)] 不過請注意，精確度的問題，仍適用於的中點值捨入。Note, though, that the problem of precision still applies to rounding of midpoint values. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 方法。For more information, see the method. - 近似相等測試而不是等號比較。Test for approximate equality rather than equality. 這需要您定義是絕對數量的兩個值可以不同，但仍視為相等，或您定義從較大的值較小的值可以分離的相對量。This requires that you define either an absolute amount by which the two values can differ but still be equal, or that you define a relative amount by which the smaller value can diverge from the larger value. > [!WARNING] > 有時候會為絕對的量值的兩個距離值在等號比較測試。 is sometimes used as an absolute measure of the distance between two values when testing for equality. 不過，測量的最小的可能值，可以加入或減去，其值為零。However, measures the smallest possible value that can be added to, or subtracted from, a whose value is zero. 大部分的正數和負數值、 值太小，無法偵測到。For most positive and negative values, the value of is too small to be detected. 因此，除了為零的值，我們不建議用於測試相等。Therefore, except for values that are zero, we do not recommend its use in tests for equality. 下列範例會使用第二種方法來定義`IsApproximatelyEqual`方法來測試兩個值之間的相對差異。The following example uses the latter approach to define an `IsApproximatelyEqual` method that tests the relative difference between two values. 它也會對照的呼叫結果`IsApproximatelyEqual`方法和方法。It also contrasts the result of calls to the `IsApproximatelyEqual` method and the method. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison4.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison4.vb#12)] ## 浮點值和例外狀況Floating-Point Values and Exceptions 不同於整數型別，擲回例外狀況在溢位或不合法的作業，例如除以零，與作業具有浮點值的作業不擲回例外狀況。Unlike operations with integral types, which throw exceptions in cases of overflow or illegal operations such as division by zero, operations with floating-point values do not throw exceptions. 相反地，例外的情況下，浮點運算的結果是零，正無限大、 負無限大或不是數字 (NaN):Instead, in exceptional situations, the result of a floating-point operation is zero, positive infinity, negative infinity, or not a number (NaN): - 如果浮點運算的結果太小，目的格式，則結果為零。If the result of a floating-point operation is too small for the destination format, the result is zero. 發生這個問題相乘兩個非常小的數字，如下列範例所示。This can occur when two very small numbers are multiplied, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/exceptional1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/exceptional1.vb#1)] - 浮點運算的結果大小超出目的格式的範圍，運算的結果是否或視結果的正負號。If the magnitude of the result of a floating-point operation exceeds the range of the destination format, the result of the operation is or , as appropriate for the sign of the result. 作業的溢位結果是，和作業的溢位結果是，如下列範例所示。The result of an operation that overflows is , and the result of an operation that overflows is , as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/exceptional2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/exceptional2.vb#2)] 也會產生從分區與正被除數為零和除法運算會產生與負被除數為零。 also results from a division by zero with a positive dividend, and results from a division by zero with a negative dividend. - 如果是無效的浮點運算，作業的結果會是。If a floating-point operation is invalid, the result of the operation is . 例如，天時，下列作業：For example, results from the following operations: - 除數為零與被除數為零。Division by zero with a dividend of zero. 注意除法的其他案例中零個結果或。Note that other cases of division by zero result in either or . - 無效的輸入與任何浮點運算。Any floating-point operation with an invalid input. 例如，呼叫含有負值的方法會傳回，如同呼叫值大於 1 或更少負一的方法。For example, calling the method with a negative value returns , as does calling the method with a value that is greater than one or less than negative one. - 引數，其值的任何作業。Any operation with an argument whose value is . ## 類型轉換和雙精確度結構Type conversions and the Double structure 結構並未定義任何明確或隱含的轉換運算子; 相反地，由編譯器所實作的轉換。The structure does not define any explicit or implicit conversion operators; instead, conversions are implemented by the compiler. 轉換至任何基本數值類型的值擴展轉換，因此不需要明確轉換運算子或呼叫轉換方法，除非明確編譯器需要它。The conversion of the value of any primitive numeric type to a is a widening conversion and therefore does not require an explicit cast operator or call to a conversion method unless a compiler explicitly requires it. 例如，C# 編譯器需要轉型運算子從不至，而 Visual Basic 編譯器並不會。For example, the C# compiler requires a casting operator for conversions from to , while the Visual Basic compiler does not. 下列範例會將轉換至其他基本數值類型的最小值或最大值。The following example converts the minimum or maximum value of other primitive numeric types to a . [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#20](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/convert1.cs#20)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#20](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/convert1.vb#20)] 此外，值， ，和轉換至， ，和分別。In addition, the values , , and covert to , , and , respectively. 請注意，某些數值類型的值轉換值可能會涉及遺失有效位數。Note that the conversion of the value of some numeric types to a value can involve a loss of precision. 如範例所示，遺失有效位數時，可能轉換， ， ，和值值。As the example illustrates, a loss of precision is possible when converting , , , and values to values. 轉換值到其他任何基本數值資料類型的值是縮小轉換，而且需要轉換運算子 （C# 中），轉換方法 （在 Visual Basic) 或呼叫方法。The conversion of a value to a value of any other primitive numeric data type is a narrowing conversion and requires a cast operator (in C#), a conversion method (in Visual Basic), or a call to a method. 值超出範圍的目標資料類型由目標類型的定義`MinValue`和`MaxValue`屬性下, 表所示的行為。Values that are outside the range of the target data type, which are defined by the target type's `MinValue` and `MaxValue` properties, behave as shown in the following table. |目標類型Target type|結果Result| |-----------------|------------| |任何整數類資料類型Any integral type|例外狀況，如果該轉換是發生在檢查的內容。An exception if the conversion occurs in a checked context.

如果該轉換是發生在 unchecked 內容中 （C# 中的預設值），轉換作業會成功，但值溢位。If the conversion occurs in an unchecked context (the default in C#), the conversion operation succeeds but the value overflows.| || 例外狀況。An exception.| || 負數的值。 for negative values.

正值。 for positive values.| 此外， ， ，和擲回checked 的內容中，但這些值溢位時未檢查的內容中轉換為整數的整數的轉換。In addition, , , and throw an for conversions to integers in a checked context, but these values overflow when converted to integers in an unchecked context. 轉換，它們一定會擲回。For conversions to , they always throw an . 轉換，它們會轉換成， ，和分別。For conversions to , they convert to , , and , respectively. 附註的精確度的喪失可能會導致從轉換另一個數字類型的值。Note that a loss of precision may result from converting a value to another numeric type. 如果是轉換非整數值，如範例輸出所示，小數部分為時遺失值 （如同在 Visual Basic) 四捨五入或截斷 （如同在 C# 中)。In the case of converting non-integral values, as the output from the example shows, the fractional component is lost when the value is either rounded (as in Visual Basic) or truncated (as in C#). 轉換和值值不能精確的表示法中的目標資料類型。For conversions to and values, the value may not have a precise representation in the target data type. 下列範例會將轉換的數字的數個其他數值類型的值。The following example converts a number of values to several other numeric types. 在 Visual Basic （預設值） 和 C# 中檢查的內容中發生的轉換 (因為[檢查](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/checked.md)關鍵字)。The conversions occur in a checked context in Visual Basic (the default) and in C# (because of the [checked](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/checked.md) keyword). 範例輸出顯示轉換的結果中這兩個核取 unchecked 的內容中。The output from the example shows the result for conversions in both a checked an unchecked context. 您也可以使用編譯 Visual Basic 中未檢查的內容中執行轉換`/removeintchecks+`編譯器參數和 C# 註解`checked`陳述式。You can perform conversions in an unchecked context in Visual Basic by compiling with the `/removeintchecks+` compiler switch and in C# by commenting out the `checked` statement. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#21](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/convert2.cs#21)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#21](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/convert2.vb#21)] 如需有關轉換的數字類型的詳細資訊，請參閱[.NET Framework 中的型別轉換](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md)和[類型轉換表](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md)。For more information on the conversion of numeric types, see [Type Conversion in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md) and [Type Conversion Tables](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md). ## 浮點數的功能Floating-Point Functionality 結構以及相關的類型提供的下列區域中執行作業的方法：The structure and related types provide methods to perform operations in the following areas: - **值的比較**。**Comparison of values**. 您可以呼叫方法，以判斷兩個值是否相等，或方法，以判斷兩個值之間的關聯性。You can call the method to determine whether two values are equal, or the method to determine the relationship between two values. 結構也支援一組完整的比較運算子。The structure also supports a complete set of comparison operators. 例如，您可以測試相等或不等，或判斷某個值是否大於或等於另一個。For example, you can test for equality or inequality, or determine whether one value is greater than or equal to another. 如果其中一個運算元為數值型別以外，它會轉換成之前執行的比較。If one of the operands is a numeric type other than a , it is converted to a before performing the comparison. > [!WARNING] > 有效位數，因此兩個您希望為相等的值可能會變得不相等，這會影響比較的結果。Because of differences in precision, two values that you expect to be equal may turn out to be unequal, which affects the result of the comparison. 請參閱[測試是否相等](#Equality)> 一節，如需有關比較兩個值。See the [Testing for Equality](#Equality) section for more information about comparing two values. 您也可以呼叫， ， ，和方法來測試這些特殊值。You can also call the , , , and methods to test for these special values. - **數學運算**。**Mathematical operations**. 語言編譯器和通用中繼語言 (CIL) 的指示，而非實作常用的算術運算，例如加法、 減法、 乘法和除法方法。Common arithmetic operations, such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, are implemented by language compilers and Common Intermediate Language (CIL) instructions, rather than by methods. 如果其中一個數學運算的運算元為數值型別以外，它會轉換成之前執行此作業。If one of the operands in a mathematical operation is a numeric type other than a , it is converted to a before performing the operation. 作業的結果也是值。The result of the operation is also a value. 可以執行其他數學運算，藉由呼叫`static`(`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中) 中的方法類別。Other mathematical operations can be performed by calling `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) methods in the class. 它包含常用的算術運算的其他方法 (例如， ，和)，幾何 (例如和)，和微積分 (例如)。It includes additional methods commonly used for arithmetic (such as , , and ), geometry (such as and ), and calculus (such as ). 您也可以使用操作中的個別位元值。You can also manipulate the individual bits in a value. 方法可保留值的位元模式中的 64 位元整數。The method preserves a value's bit pattern in a 64-bit integer. 方法會傳回其位元模式中的位元組陣列。The method returns its bit pattern in a byte array. - **捨入**。**Rounding**. 捨入通常用於一種技術以降低的浮點表示和精確度的問題所導致的值之間的差異的影響。Rounding is often used as a technique for reducing the impact of differences between values caused by problems of floating-point representation and precision. 您可以藉由四捨五入藉由呼叫值方法。You can round a value by calling the method. - **格式化**。**Formatting**. 您可以將轉換值至它的字串表示，藉由呼叫方法或使用複合格式功能。You can convert a value to its string representation by calling the method or by using the composite formatting feature. 格式字串控制浮點值的字串表示方式的相關資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)主題。For information about how format strings control the string representation of floating-point values, see the [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md) topics. - **剖析字串**。**Parsing strings**. 您可以將浮點值的字串表示轉換藉由呼叫值或方法。You can convert the string representation of a floating-point value to a value by calling either the or method. 如果剖析作業失敗，方法會擲回例外狀況，而方法會傳回`false`。If the parse operation fails, the method throws an exception, whereas the method returns `false`. - **類型轉換**。**Type conversion**. 結構提供的明確介面實作介面，支援任何兩個的標準.NET Framework 資料型別之間的轉換。The structure provides an explicit interface implementation for the interface, which supports conversion between any two standard .NET Framework data types. 語言編譯器也支援隱含的所有其他標準數值類型的值轉換值。Language compilers also support the implicit conversion of values of all other standard numeric types to values. 值的任何標準的數值類型，來轉換擴展轉換，而且不需要轉型運算子或轉換方法，使用者Conversion of a value of any standard numeric type to a is a widening conversion and does not require the user of a casting operator or conversion method, 不過，轉換和值可能是遺失有效位數。However, conversion of and values can involve a loss of precision. 下表列出的每一種類型的有效位數的差異：The following table lists the differences in precision for each of these types: |類型Type|最大有效位數Maximum precision|內部的有效位數Internal precision| |----------|-----------------------|------------------------| ||1515|1717| ||19 的十進位數字19 decimal digits|19 的十進位數字19 decimal digits| ||7 位數7 decimal digits|9 的十進位數字9 decimal digits| 有效位數問題通常會影響值轉換成值。The problem of precision most frequently affects values that are converted to values. 在下列範例中，兩個相同的除法作業所產生的值不相等，所以其中一個值之單精確度浮點值轉換成。In the following example, two values produced by identical division operations are unequal because one of the values is a single-precision floating point value converted to a . [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/representation1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/representation1.vb#3)] ## Examples 下列程式碼範例說明使用:The following code example illustrates the use of : [!code-cpp[Double Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Double Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Double Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Double Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Double Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Double Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值必須相同才會被視為相等。Values must be identical to be considered equal. 特別是當浮點數的值相依於多個數學作業時，常會遺失有效位數和其值為幾乎完全相同，除了其最小有效位數。Particularly when floating-point values depend on multiple mathematical operations, it is common for them to lose precision and for their values to be nearly identical except for their least significant digits. 因為這個緣故，傳回值方法有時可能看起來很令人意外。Because of this, the return value of the method at times may seem surprising. 例如，特定值後面接著除法由相同的值乘以應該會產生原始值。For example, multiplication by a particular value followed by division by the same value should produce the original value. 在下列範例中，不過，計算的值結果必須大於原始值。In the following example, however, the computed value turns out to be greater than the original value. 顯示兩個值的所有有效位數使用"R"[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)表示計算的值，不同於其最小有效位數的原始值。Showing all significant digits of the two values by using the "R" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) indicates that the computed value differs from the original value in its least significant digits. 在處理這類比較的資訊，請參閱的 < 備註 > 一節方法。For information on handling such comparisons, see the Remarks section of the method. [!code-csharp[System.Double.CompareTo#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.compareto/cs/compareto2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.CompareTo#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.compareto/vb/compareto2.vb#1)] 這個方法會實作介面並執行稍微優於方法因為並沒有轉換`value`參數物件。This method implements the interface and performs slightly better than the method because it does not have to convert the `value` parameter to an object. 請注意，雖然物件，其值為不會視為等於另一個物件，其值為（甚至本身），介面需要`A.CompareTo(A)`傳回零。Note that, although an object whose value is is not considered equal to another object whose value is (even itself), the interface requires that `A.CompareTo(A)` return zero. ## 擴展轉換Widening Conversions 根據您的程式語言，可能會以程式碼方法的參數型別具有較少的位元的位置 （較窄） 與執行個體類型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 這可能是因為有些程式語言會執行隱含擴展轉換，表示參數為型別與相同位元數與執行個體。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假設執行個體類型是和參數類型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 編譯器會產生代表做為參數的值指示物件，然後產生比較執行個體的值與參數擴大的表示的方法。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as a object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the widened representation of the parameter. 請參閱您的程式語言的文件，以判斷其編譯器是否會執行隱含的擴展轉換的數字類型。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine if its compiler performs implicit widening conversions of numeric types. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[類型轉換表](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md)主題。For more information, see the [Type Conversion Tables](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md) topic. ## 在比較中的有效位數Precision in Comparisons 超過記載的精確度的浮點數的精確度是特定實作] 和 [.NET Framework 版本。The precision of floating-point numbers beyond the documented precision is specific to the implementation and version of the .NET Framework. 因此，比較兩個特定的數字可能會變更.NET Framework 版本之間的有效位數的數字的內部表示法可能會變更。Consequently, a comparison of two particular numbers might change between versions of the .NET Framework because the precision of the numbers' internal representation might change. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範泛型和非泛型版本的數個值和參考類型的方法。The following code example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`參數必須是`null`或執行個體`Double`，否則會擲回例外狀況。The `value` parameter must be `null` or an instance of `Double`; otherwise, an exception is thrown. 任何執行個體，不論其值會被視為大於`null`。Any instance of , regardless of its value, is considered greater than `null`. 值必須相同才會被視為相等。Values must be identical to be considered equal. 特別是當浮點數的值相依於多個數學作業時，常會遺失有效位數和其值為幾乎完全相同，除了其最小有效位數。Particularly when floating-point values depend on multiple mathematical operations, it is common for them to lose precision and for their values to be nearly identical except for their least significant digits. 因為這個緣故，傳回值方法有時可能看起來很令人意外。Because of this, the return value of the method at times may seem surprising. 例如，特定值後面接著除法由相同的值乘以應該會產生原始值。For example, multiplication by a particular value followed by division by the same value should produce the original value. 在下列範例中，不過，計算的值結果必須大於原始值。In the following example, however, the computed value turns out to be greater than the original value. 顯示兩個值的所有有效位數使用"R"[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)表示計算的值，不同於其最小有效位數的原始值。Showing all significant digits of the two values by using the "R" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) indicates that the computed value differs from the original value in its least significant digits. 在處理這類比較的資訊，請參閱的 < 備註 > 一節方法。For information on handling such comparisons, see the Remarks section of the method. [!code-csharp[System.Double.CompareTo#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.compareto/cs/compareto3.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Double.CompareTo#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.compareto/vb/compareto3.vb#2)] 這個方法實作以支援介面。This method is implemented to support the interface. 請注意，雖然不被視為等於另一個（甚至本身），介面需要`A.CompareTo(A)`傳回零。Note that, although a is not considered to be equal to another (even itself), the interface requires that `A.CompareTo(A)` return zero. ## 在比較中的有效位數Precision in Comparisons 超過記載的精確度的浮點數的精確度是特定實作] 和 [.NET Framework 版本。The precision of floating-point numbers beyond the documented precision is specific to the implementation and version of the .NET Framework. 因此，比較兩個特定的數字可能會變更.NET Framework 版本之間的有效位數的數字的內部表示法可能會變更。Consequently, a comparison of two particular numbers might change between versions of the .NET Framework because the precision of the numbers' internal representation might change. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例說明使用`CompareTo`的內容中`Double`。The following code example illustrates the use of `CompareTo` in the context of `Double`. [!code-cpp[System.Double#16](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double/CPP/doublesample.cpp#16)] [!code-csharp[System.Double#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double/CS/doublesample.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Double#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double/VB/doublesample.vb#16)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值屬性會反映最小正非常重要數字的操作或比較的值時的值執行個體是零。The value of the property reflects the smallest positive value that is significant in numeric operations or comparisons when the value of the instance is zero. 例如，下列程式碼所示的零和會被視為不相等的值，而零和一半的值會被視為相等。For example, the following code shows that zero and are considered to be unequal values, whereas zero and half the value of are considered to be equal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/epsilon.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/epsilon.vb#5)] 更明確地說，浮點格式包含正負號、 52 位元尾數或有效數字和 11 位元的指數的點。More precisely, the floating point format consists of a sign, a 52-bit mantissa or significand, and an 11-bit exponent. 如下列範例所示，零會有-1022年指數和尾數為 0。As the following example shows, zero has an exponent of -1022 and a mantissa of 0. 具有-1022年指數和尾數的 1。 has an exponent of -1022 and a mantissa of 1. 這表示最小正數值小於或等於零，表示可能的最小值和最小可能增量的指數，是-1022年。This means that is the smallest positive value greater than zero and represents the smallest possible value and the smallest possible increment for a whose exponent is -1022. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/epsilon1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/epsilon1.vb#6)] 不過，屬性不是一般量值的有效位數輸入; 它只適用於具有零值或-1022年指數的執行個體。However, the property is not a general measure of precision of the type; it applies only to instances that have a value of zero or an exponent of -1022. > [!NOTE] > 值屬性不等於機器 epsilon，表示相對的錯誤，因為浮點算術中的捨入的上限。The value of the property is not equivalent to machine epsilon, which represents the upper bound of the relative error due to rounding in floating-point arithmetic. 這個常數的值是 4.94065645841247 e-324。The value of this constant is 4.94065645841247e-324. 兩個明顯的對等的浮點數進行比較時可能並不相等，這是因為在其最小有效位數的差異。Two apparently equivalent floating-point numbers might not compare equal because of differences in their least significant digits. 例如，C# 運算式`(double)1/3 == (double)0.33333`，不會比較相等因為左邊算起的除法運算子具有最大有效位數，而右邊的常數只能精確到指定的數字。For example, the C# expression, `(double)1/3 == (double)0.33333`, does not compare equal because the division operation on the left side has maximum precision while the constant on the right side is precise only to the specified digits. 如果您建立自訂的演算法會決定是否可以視為兩個浮點數相等時，我們不建議的值根據您的演算法来建立的差異可接受絕對邊界常數兩個值被視為相等。If you create a custom algorithm that determines whether two floating-point numbers can be considered equal, we do not recommend that you base your algorithm on the value of the constant to establish the acceptable absolute margin of difference for the two values to be considered equal. (一般而言，該邊界的差異大於多次。)比較兩個雙精確度浮點值的相關資訊，請參閱和。(Typically, that margin of difference is many times greater than .) For information about comparing two double-precision floating-point values, see and . ## 平台注意事項Platform Notes 在 ARM 系統上，值常數是被偵測太小，因此它等同於零。On ARM systems, the value of the constant is too small to be detected, so it equates to zero. 您可以定義替代 epsilon 值等於 2.2250738585072014 e-308 改為。You can define an alternative epsilon value that equals 2.2250738585072014E-308 instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會實作介面，並執行稍微優於因為並沒有轉換`obj`參數物件。This method implements the interface, and performs slightly better than because it does not have to convert the `obj` parameter to an object. ## 擴展轉換Widening Conversions 根據您的程式語言，可能會以程式碼方法的參數型別具有較少的位元的位置 （較窄） 與執行個體類型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 這可能是因為有些程式語言會執行隱含擴展轉換，表示參數為型別與相同位元數與執行個體。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假設執行個體類型是和參數類型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 編譯器會產生代表做為參數的值指示物件，然後產生比較執行個體的值與參數擴大的表示的方法。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as a object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the widened representation of the parameter. 請參閱您的程式語言的文件，以判斷其編譯器是否會執行隱含的擴展轉換的數字類型。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine if its compiler performs implicit widening conversions of numeric types. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[類型轉換表](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md)主題。For more information, see the [Type Conversion Tables](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md) topic. ## 在比較中的有效位數Precision in Comparisons 方法應小心，因為看起來相等的兩個值可能會因不同的有效位數的兩個值不相等。The method should be used with caution, because two apparently equivalent values can be unequal due to the differing precision of the two values. 下列範例會報告值.333333 和1 除以 3 傳回的值不相等。The following example reports that the value .333333 and the value returned by dividing 1 by 3 are unequal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/Equals_25051.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/Equals_25051.vb#1)] 而不是比較是否相等，其中一種技術需要定義可接受兩個值之間差異的相對範圍 (例如。 001%的其中一個值)。Rather than comparing for equality, one technique involves defining an acceptable relative margin of difference between two values (such as .001% of one of the values). 如果兩個值之間的差異的絕對值小於或等於該邊界，差異很可能是因為有效位數的差異並且，因此，值可能會相等。If the absolute value of the difference between the two values is less than or equal to that margin, the difference is likely to be due to differences in precision and, therefore, the values are likely to be equal. 下列範例會使用這項技術來比較.33333 和 1/3，這兩個先前的程式碼範例所找到不相等的值。The following example uses this technique to compare .33333 and 1/3, the two values that the previous code example found to be unequal. 在此情況下，值相等。In this case, the values are equal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/Equals_25051.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/Equals_25051.vb#2)] > [!NOTE] > 因為定義的最小的運算式其範圍是近於零的正數值，兩個類似值之間差異的邊界必須是大於。Because defines the minimum expression of a positive value whose range is near zero, the margin of difference between two similar values must be greater than . 一般來說，這是多次大於。Typically, it is many times greater than . 因此，我們建議您不要使用比較時值是否相等。Because of this, we recommend that you do not use when comparing values for equality. 第二項技術牽涉到比較兩個浮點數，與某些絕對值之間的差異。A second technique involves comparing the difference between two floating-point numbers with some absolute value. 差別在於小於或等於該絕對值的數字相等。If the difference is less than or equal to that absolute value, the numbers are equal. 如果較大，則數字不相等。If it is greater, the numbers are not equal. 一種替代方法是任意選取絕對值。One alternative is to arbitrarily select an absolute value. 這是有問題，不過，因為可接受範圍的差異而定的量級值。This is problematic, however, because an acceptable margin of difference depends on the magnitude of the values. 第二個替代方式利用浮點格式的設計功能： 兩個浮點值的整數表示法之間的差異表示用來分隔它們可能的浮點值的數目。A second alternative takes advantage of a design feature of the floating-point format: The difference between the integer representation of two floating-point values indicates the number of possible floating-point values that separates them. 例如，0.0 之間的差異和為 1，因為是可顯示的最小值，當使用其值為零。For example, the difference between 0.0 and is 1, because is the smallest representable value when working with a whose value is zero. 下列範例會使用這項技術來比較.33333 和 1/3，也就是兩個值先前的程式碼範例，但方法所找到不相等。The following example uses this technique to compare .33333 and 1/3, which are the two values that the previous code example with the method found to be unequal. 請注意，此範例會使用方法，將雙精確度浮點值轉換為其整數表示。Note that the example uses the method to convert a double-precision floating-point value to its integer representation. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/cs/equalsabs1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/vb/equalsabs1.vb#1)] 超過記載的精確度的浮點數的精確度是特定實作] 和 [.NET Framework 版本。The precision of floating-point numbers beyond the documented precision is specific to the implementation and version of the .NET Framework. 因此，比較兩個特定的數字可能會變更.NET Framework 版本之間的有效位數的數字的內部表示法可能會變更。Consequently, a comparison of two particular numbers might change between versions of the .NET Framework because the precision of the numbers' internal representation might change. 如果兩個藉由呼叫測試值是否相等方法，該方法會傳回`true`。If two values are tested for equality by calling the method, the method returns `true`. 不過，如果有兩個值會使用等號比較運算子來測試是否相等，則運算子會傳回`false`。However, if two values are tested for equality by using the equality operator, the operator returns `false`. 當您想要判斷是否值不是數字 (NaN)，另一個方法是呼叫方法。When you want to determine whether the value of a is not a number (NaN), an alternative is to call the method.

block.para:
編譯器的多載解析可能會說明行為中的兩個明顯的差別方法多載。Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. 如果之間的隱含轉換引數和定義及引數未當做輸入，編譯器可能會執行隱含轉換以及呼叫方法。If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers may perform an implicit conversion and call the method. 否則，呼叫方法，它一定會傳回如果其引數不是值。Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. 下列範例說明這兩個方法多載之間的行為差異。The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. 在所有基本數字型別除了，並在 C# 中，傳回第一個比較因為編譯器會自動執行擴展轉換，並呼叫方法，而第二個比較傳回因為編譯器會呼叫方法。In the case of all primitive numeric types except for and in C#, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`參數可以包含目前的文化特性， ， ，或格式的字串：The `s` parameter can contain the current culture's , , , or a string of the form: [*ws*][*sign*][*integral-digits*[*,*]]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*sign*][*integral-digits*[*,*]]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表描述每個項目。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|一系列的空格字元。A series of white-space characters.| |*簽署**sign*|負號符號 （-） 或正號符號 （+）。A negative sign symbol (-) or a positive sign symbol (+). 可以使用前置正負號。Only a leading sign can be used.| |*integral-digits**integral-digits*|一連串的數字，範圍從 0 到 9 的指定數目的整數部分。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the integral part of the number. 執行*整數位數*可以由群組分隔符號分割。Runs of *integral-digits* can be partitioned by a group-separator symbol. 例如，在某些文化特性逗號 （，） 分隔千分位群組。For example, in some cultures a comma (,) separates groups of thousands. *整數位數*項目可以是若字串包含*小數點後數字*項目。The *integral-digits* element can be absent if the string contains the *fractional-digits* element.| |,,|特定文化特性的千分位分隔符號。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |。.|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|一系列的範圍從 0 到指定的數字的小數部分的 9 位數。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the fractional part of the number.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字元，表示此值會表示指數 （科學記號） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation.| |*exponential-digits**exponential-digits*|一系列的範圍從 0 到 9 的指定指數的數字。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify an exponent.| `s`參數會使用的組合來解譯和旗標。The `s` parameter is interpreted using a combination of the and flags. 這表示泛空白字元和千位分隔符號允許，比方說，而不是貨幣符號。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed, for example, while currency symbols are not. 針對精細控制高於的樣式項目才允許`s`剖析作業成功，針對呼叫或方法。For finer control over which style elements are permitted in `s` for the parse operation to succeed, call the or the method. `s`參數的使用中的格式設定資訊解譯初始化為目前執行緒文化特性的物件。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current thread culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要剖析字串，使用其他文化特性格式資訊，請呼叫或方法。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other culture, call the or method. 一般情況下，如果您要傳入方法透過呼叫建立的字串方法、 原始會傳回值。Ordinarily, if you pass the method a string that is created by calling the method, the original value is returned. 不過，由於遺失有效位數，值可能不相等。However, because of a loss of precision, the values may not be equal. 此外，嘗試剖析任一個的字串表示或會擲回，如下列範例所示。In addition, attempting to parse the string representation of either or throws an , as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Parse/cs/parse2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Parse/vb/parse2.vb#3)] 如果發現中分隔符號`s`期間剖析作業，以及適用的貨幣或十進位數的參數和群組分隔符號都相同，剖析作業會假設分隔符號是十進位的分隔符號，而不是群組分隔符號。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 如需分隔符號的詳細資訊，請參閱， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 在下列程式碼中，說明了如何使用 方法。The following example illustrates the use of the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks `style`參數定義的樣式項目 (例如泛空白字元，千位分隔符號和貨幣符號) 中允許`s`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space, thousands separators, and currency symbols) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必須從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 下列不支援的成員：The following members are not supported: - - `s`參數可以包含目前的文化特性， ，或。The `s` parameter can contain the current culture's , , or . 值而定`style`，它也可採用的形式：Depending on the value of `style`, it can also take the form: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*integral-digits*[*,*]]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*integral-digits*[*,*]]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表描述每個項目。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|一系列的空格字元。A series of white-space characters. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |$|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義和目前文化特性的屬性。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the current culture. 目前文化特性的貨幣符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|負號符號 （-） 或正號符號 （+）。A negative sign symbol (-) or a positive sign symbol (+). 符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` *fractional-digits* element.| |,,|特定文化特性的群組分隔符號。A culture-specific group separator. 目前的文化特性群組分隔符號可出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標The current culture's group separator symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag| |。.|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 目前的文化特性小數點符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|一系列的範圍從 0 到指定的數字的小數部分的 9 位數。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the fractional part of the number. 小數點後數字才會出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。Fractional digits of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify an exponent.| 只有數字的字串 (對應於樣式) 一律會成功剖析。A string with digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 其餘成員控制可能存在，但不一定要出現在輸入字串中的項目。The remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載方法通常用來將各種不同的方式來格式化的文字轉換值。This overload of the method is typically used to convert text that can be formatted in a variety of ways to a value. 例如，它可以用來將由使用者在 HTML 文字方塊中輸入數值的文字轉換。For example, it can be used to convert the text that is entered by a user into an HTML text box to a numeric value. `s`參數會使用的組合來解譯和旗標。The `s` parameter is interpreted using a combination of the and flags. `s`參數可以包含， ，或所指定的文化特性`provider`，或者也可以包含格式的字串：The `s` parameter can contain , , or for the culture specified by `provider`, or it can contain a string of the form: [*ws*][*sign*]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*] 選擇性的項目包覆以方括號 （[和]）。Optional elements are framed in square brackets ([ and ]). 包含 「 數字"一詞的項目是由一系列的範圍從 0 到 9 的數字字元。Elements that contain the term "digits" consist of a series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|一系列的空格字元。A series of white-space characters.| |*簽署**sign*|負號符號 （-） 或正號符號 （+）。A negative sign symbol (-) or a positive sign symbol (+).| |*integral-digits**integral-digits*|一連串的數字，範圍從 0 到 9 的指定數目的整數部分。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the integral part of the number. 執行*整數位數*可以由群組分隔符號分割。Runs of *integral-digits* can be partitioned by a group-separator symbol. 例如，在某些文化特性逗號 （，） 分隔千分位群組。For example, in some cultures a comma (,) separates groups of thousands. *整數位數*項目可以是若字串包含*小數點後數字*項目。The *integral-digits* element can be absent if the string contains the *fractional-digits* element.| |。.|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|一系列的範圍從 0 到指定的數字的小數部分的 9 位數。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the fractional part of the number.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字元，表示此值會表示指數 （科學記號） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation.| |*exponential-digits**exponential-digits*|一系列的範圍從 0 到 9 的指定指數的數字。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify an exponent.| 如需數字格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)主題。For more information about numeric formats, see the [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md) topic. `provider`參數是實作其方法會傳回物件，提供特定文化特性資訊，用於解譯的格式`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that supplies culture-specific information used in interpreting the format of `s`. 一般來說，這是或物件。Typically, it is a or object. 如果`provider`是`null`或無法取得的格式設定資訊會使用目前的系統文化特性。If `provider` is `null` or a cannot be obtained, the formatting information for the current system culture is used. 一般情況下，如果您要傳入方法透過呼叫建立的字串方法、 原始會傳回值。Ordinarily, if you pass the method a string that is created by calling the method, the original value is returned. 不過，由於遺失有效位數，值可能不相等。However, because of a loss of precision, the values may not be equal. 此外，嘗試剖析任一個的字串表示或會擲回，如下列範例所示。In addition, attempting to parse the string culture|| |特定的格式或有效位數A specific format or precision|特定文化特性A specific culture|| 傳回值可以是， ， ，或格式的字串：The return value can be , , , or a string of the form: [sign]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits][sign]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits] 選擇性的項目包覆以方括號 （[和]）。Optional elements are framed in square brackets ([ and ]). 包含 「 數字"一詞的項目是由一系列的範圍從 0 到 9 的數字字元。Elements that contain the term "digits" consist of a series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9. 支援下表中列出的項目。The elements listed in the following table are supported. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*簽署**sign*|負號或正號。A negative sign or positive sign symbol.| |'*e*''*e*'|小寫字元 'e'，表示指數 （科學記號）。A lowercase character 'e', indicating exponential (scientific) notation.| |*exponential-digits**exponential-digits*|指定數字的指數。A series of digits specifying an exponent.| span.span: A numeric format string.

summary.span: 使用指定格式，將這個執行個體的數值轉換成它的相等字串表示。

span.span: Converts the numeric value of this instance to its equivalent string representation, using the specified format.

returns.span: 這個執行個體值的字串表示，如同 所指定。

span.span: The string representation of the value of this instance as specified by .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式使用目前文化特性的慣例來指定格式的值。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果您想要指定不同的格式或文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |特定的格式或有效位數A specific format or precision|特定文化特性A specific culture|| 傳回值可以是， ， ，數字，所指定的字串表示法`format`。The return value can be , , , or the string representation of a number, as specified by `format`. `format`參數可以是任何有效的標準數值格式規範，除了 D 和 X，以及自訂數值格式規範的任何組合。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard numeric format specifier except for D and X, as well as any combination of custom numeric format specifiers. 如果`format`是`null`或空字串，傳回值會格式化為具有一般數值格式規範 ("G")。If `format` is `null` or an empty string, the return value is formatted with the general numeric format specifier ("G"). .NET Framework 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 根據預設，傳回的值只包含 15 個位數的有效位數雖然內部維護最多 17 個位數。By default, the return value only contains 15 digits of precision although a maximum of 17 digits is maintained internally. 如果這個執行個體的值必須大於 15 位數，傳回或而不是預期的數目。If the value of this instance has greater than 15 digits, returns or instead of the expected number. 如果您需要更多有效位數時，指定`format`"G17"格式規格，它一定會傳回 17 個位數的精確度或"R"，它會傳回 15 位數數目可以使用 17 位數來表示，如果數字只能如果表示最大有效位數。If you require more precision, specify `format` with the "G17" format specification, which always returns 17 digits of precision, or "R", which returns 15 digits if the number can be represented with that precision or 17 digits if the number can only be represented with maximum precision. ## Examples 下列範例定義的數值，並將其格式化為貨幣值使用"C"標準數值格式字串和三個小數位數以數值形式使用"N"標準數值格式字串。The following example defines a numeric value and formats it as a currency value by using the "C" standard numeric format string and as a numeric value to three decimal places by using the "N" standard numeric format string. 結果字串會使用 EN-US 文化特性的慣例來格式化。The result strings are formatted by using the conventions of the en-US culture. 如需有關數值格式字串的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information on numeric format strings, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). [!code-csharp[System.Double.ToString#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cs/ToString7.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Double.ToString#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/vb/ToString7.vb#7)] 下列範例會顯示數個使用支援標準數值格式規範，以及三個自訂數值格式字串值。The following example displays several values using the supported standard numeric format specifiers together with three custom numeric format strings. 這些自訂格式字串的其中一個說明如何填補加上前置零的值。One of those custom format strings illustrates how to pad a value with leading zeros. 此外，此範例會使用精確度規範，使用"R"除了每個標準格式規範。In addition, the example uses precision specifiers with each standard format specifier except for "R". 有效位數規範範圍從 0 到 3 的值。The values of the precision specifiers range from 0 to 3. 若要將數字的值轉換成字串，此範例會使用 EN-US 文化特性的格式設定慣例。To convert the numeric values to strings, the example uses the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. [!code-cpp[System.Double.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cpp/tostring3.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Double.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cs/ToString1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/vb/ToString1.vb#3)]

span.span: is invalid.

block.para:
在某些情況下，使用 "R" 標準數值格式字串格式化的 值，如果使用 或 參數編譯並在 64 位元系統上執行，則不會成功地反覆存取。In some cases, values formatted with the "R" standard numeric format string do not successfully round-trip if compiled using the or switches and run on 64-bit systems. 若要解決這個問題，您可以使用 "G17" 標準數值格式字串來格式化 值。To work around this problem, you can format values by using the "G17" standard numeric format string. 下列範例使用 "R" 格式字串，搭配不會成功反覆存取的 值，並且也會使用 "G17" 格式字串來成功反覆存取原始值。The following example uses the "R" format string with a value that does not round-trip successfully, and also uses the "G17" format string to successfully round-trip the original value.
[!code-csharp[System.Double.ToString#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cs/roundtripex2.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Double.ToString#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/vb/roundtripex2.vb#6)]

在某些情況下，使用 "R" 標準數值格式字串格式化的 值，如果使用 或 參數編譯並在 64 位元系統上執行，則不會成功地反覆存取。In some cases, values formatted with the "R" standard numeric format string do not successfully round-trip if compiled using the or switches and run on 64-bit systems. 若要解決這個問題，您可以使用 "G17" 標準數值格式字串來格式化 值。To work around this problem, you can format values by using the "G17" standard numeric format string. 下列範例使用 "R" 格式字串，搭配不會成功反覆存取的 值，並且也會使用 "G17" 格式字串來成功反覆存取原始值。The following example uses the "R" format string with a value that does not round-trip successfully, and also uses the "G17" format string to successfully round-trip the original value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載不同於藉由傳回布林值，指出是否剖析作業成功而不是傳回的已剖析的數字值的方法。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 它不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試的`s`無效，無法成功剖析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`參數可以包含目前的文化特性， ， （字串比較是區分大小寫），或格式的字串：The `s` parameter can contain the current culture's , , (the string comparison is case-sensitive), or a string of the form: [ws][sign][integral-digits,]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits][ws][ws][sign][integral-digits,]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits][ws] 方括號中的項目是選擇性的。Elements in square brackets are optional. 下表描述每個項目。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|一系列的空格字元。A series of white-space characters.| |*簽署**sign*|負號或正號。A negative sign or positive sign symbol.| |*integral-digits**integral-digits*|一連串的數字字元範圍從 0 到 9 的指定數目的整數部分。A series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the integral part of the number. 整數數字，可不存在有小數點後數字。Integral-digits can be absent if there are fractional-digits.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的群組分隔符號。A culture-specific group separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|一連串的範圍從 0 到指定的數字的小數部分的 9 的數字字元。A series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the fractional part of the number.| |*E**E*|大寫或小寫字元 'e'，表示指數 （科學記號）。An uppercase or lowercase character 'e', that indicates exponential (scientific) notation.| |*exponential-digits**exponential-digits*|一連串的範圍從 0 到 9 的指定指數的數字字元。A series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9 that specify an exponent.| 如需數字格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about numeric formats, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `s`參數使用的組合來解譯和旗標。The `s` parameter is interpreted by using a combination of the and flags. 這表示泛空白字元和千位分隔符號所允許但不是貨幣符號。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要明確定義的項目 (例如貨幣符號、 千位分隔符號和空白字元) 可以出現在`s`，使用方法多載。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method overload. `s`參數會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中初始化目前的系統文化特性的物件。The `s` parameter is parsed using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要剖析字串以使用其他的格式設定資訊指定文化特性，請使用方法多載。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other specified culture, use the method overload. 一般情況下，如果您要傳入方法透過呼叫建立的字串方法、 原始會傳回值。Ordinarily, if you pass the method a string that is created by calling the method, the original value is returned. 不過，由於遺失有效位數，值可能不相等。However, because of a loss of precision, the values may not be equal. 此外，嘗試剖析任一個的字串表示或會擲回，如下列範例所示。In addition, attempting to parse the string representation of either or throws an , as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Double.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.TryParse/cs/tryparse2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.TryParse/vb/tryparse2.vb#3)] 如果發現中分隔符號`s`期間剖析作業，以及小數和群組分隔符號的參數都相同，剖析作業會假設分隔符號是十進位的分隔符號，而不是群組分隔符號。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 如需分隔符號的詳細資訊，請參閱， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法，將數值的字串表示轉換值。The following example uses the method to convert the string representations of numeric values to values. 它會假設該 EN-US 是目前的文化特性。It assumes that en-US is the current culture. 括號可用於`s`來表示負數的值，如果`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*integral-digits**integral-digits*|一連串的數字，範圍從 0 到 9 的指定數目的整數部分。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the integral part of the number. 整數數字，可不存在有小數點後數字。Integral-digits can be absent if there are fractional-digits.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的千分位分隔符號。A culture-specific
